info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:27PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Kiowa County through 615 PM MDT... At 527 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eads, or 27 miles north of Lamar, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eads, Sheridan Lake, Neeoshe Reservoir, Towner, Sweetwater Reservoir, Chivington, Brandon, Neegronda Reservoir and Queens Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.
